Key Arguments: Freedom of speech is a cornerstone of society and should be protected.
Many statements labeled as misinformation during the COVID pandemic were later proven true.
The proposed legislation violates Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which protects freedom of opinion and expression.
The bill would interfere with the ability to receive and impart information through social media.
There is a risk of abuse of power by unelected bureaucrats if the legislation is passed.
Notable Quotes: This proposed bill to combat so-called 'misinformation and disinformation' must be wholly rejected.
It is not the role of the government to tell people what they can and cannot say or think.
